TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine, mixed, superactive, frigid Vertic Haplustepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Roques clay loam - rangeland.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted)
A--0 to 5 cm; light olive brown (2.5Y 5/4) clay loam, olive brown (2.5Y 4/4) moist; weak fine granular structure; soft, friable, moderately sticky and moderately plastic; few fine roots; few fine interstitial pores; neutral; abrupt smooth boundary.  (3 to 13 cm thick)
Bw--5 to 38 cm; light olive brown (2.5Y 5/4) clay, olive brown (2.5Y 4/4) moist; weak coarse prismatic structure parting to weak coarse subangular blocky; very hard, firm, very sticky and very plastic; few very fine and fine roots; few fine tubular pores: slightly effervescent; slightly alkaline; gradual smooth boundary.  (25 to 51 cm thick)
Bk--38 to 152 cm; light olive brown (2.5Y 5/4) clay, olive brown (2.5Y 4/4) moist; massive; very hard, very firm, very sticky and very plastic; few very fine roots; few fine tubular pores; strongly effervescent; few fine soft masses of calcium carbonate; slightly alkaline.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Rio Arriba County, New Mexico; 4 kilometers west and 7.2 kilometer south of Chama. Brazos USGS quad; New Mexico state plane coordinates 647,161 meters north and 119,570 meters east; Long. 106 degrees, 37 minutes, 01 seconds west; Lat. 36 degrees, 50 minutes, 03 seconds north.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Average Annual Soil Temperature:  5.6 to 8.3 degrees C.
Linear extensibility: 6.0 to 8.0 percent (estimated)
Control section - percent clay:  40 to 55 percent
A horizon
Value:  5 or 6 dry, 4 or 5 moist
Chroma:  2 through 4; dry or moist
Calcium carbonate equivalent: 1 to 5 percent
Reaction (pH):  6.6 to 7.8
Bw horizon
Value:  5 through 7 dry, 4 or 5 moist
Chroma:  2 through 4; dry or moist
Calcium carbonate equivalent: 1 to 5 percent
Reaction (pH):  6.6 to 7.8
Bk horizon
Value:  5 through 7 dry, 4 or 5 moist
Chroma:  2 through 4, dry or moist
Calcium carbonate equivalent: 5 to 15 percent
Reaction (pH):  7.4 to 8.4

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Landform - valley sides and alluvial fans
Elevation - 2,225 to 2,440 meters
Slopes - 2 to 8 percent
Parent material - alluvium from shale, including the Mancos Formation Average annual air temperature - 5.6 to 6.7 degrees C.
Average annual precipitation - 400 to 460 mm
Soil moisture - intermittently moist in some part December through April and July through September
Frost-free period - 80 to 100 days

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; medium runoff; very slow permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Roques soils are used for livestock grazing and wildlife habitat.  The present vegetation is western wheatgrass, sleepygrass, and western yarrow.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Northern New Mexico, southwestern Colorado. LRR D, E; MLRA 36, 48A; moderate extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Rio Arriba County, New Mexico, 1989.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon are:
Cambic horizon - 5 to 38 cm (Bw horizon)
Vertic feature is based on estimated linear extensibility.
Note: the carbonate content of the Bk horizon is assumed to be typically less than 15 percent, this needs to be verified.
Roques soils have a frigid temperature regime and are in an ustic soil moisture regime with a typic subclass.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
